data.title: Nancy Juvonen, Jimmy Fallon Wife Bio, Age, Net worth, Family
data.meta_description: Nancy Juvonen is an American ex-aviator companion, actress, film producer, loving wife and caring mother. She has a degree in sociology and was able to
data.text:
Nancy Juvonen is an American ex-aviator companion, actress, film producer, loving wife and caring mother. She has a degree in sociology and was able to put the knowledge she had acquired in school to good use. To move forward in life, she could relate very well to someone who she has worked on friendly terms with and used the connections she has made over the years to her best advantage. She was able to clearly identify where her passions lay right out of college and she has dived straight into that area of ​​life and has had much to celebrate along the way, accompanied by many rewards and recognition. Learn more about them below.

Nancy Juvonen – Biography (Age)

Nancy Juvonen was born into the Juvonen household on May 18, 1967 in Marin County, California in the United States of America. She attended high school like any other child and after graduating from the University of Southern California received a degree in sociology and cooperative education.

After graduation, she decided to move on with her life and took odd jobs to earn a living. After that she got a job at a dude ranch in the Rocky Mountain state of Wyoming in the USA.

Since her father was in the aviation business, she next got a job as a private flight attendant for an unnamed artist who used his fame, funds and influence to end homelessness in America. She then became the assistant to Clarence “Big Man” Clemons – a saxophonist and member of Bruce Springsteen’s E-Street Band; This job gave her the opportunity to meet many influential people in America and gave her a much needed big break to move on in life.

In 1993 by her brother Jim, who waswork as a producer on the film “Mad Love” with Drew Barrymore – the famous actress and Hollywood darling; She was introduced to Drew and they formed a friendship and bond that has continued to grow over the years. As their friendship and mutual understanding deepened, Drew and Nancy Juvonen founded a film production company called Flower Films in 1996.
